scenes.location: ERIE HOSPITAL FOR THE CRIMINALLY INSANE
characters: ON A LITTLE BOY AND HIS FATHER -
ON TWO THUGS DRESSED AS ELVIS...
BACK ON SHOVELER AND INVISIBLE BOY -
BACK TO THE TOP OF THE TOWER
BACK AT THE TOP 0F THE TOWER
CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN CAR AND BAR -
BACK TO CASANOVA AND THE TOP CROOKS -
ON A NEATLY PLACED COLLECTION OF PLASTER LAWN DWARVES -
CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN THEM -
ORCHESTRATED STRAINS OF "WHEN YOU WALK THROUGH A STORM"
A HAMMERING JACKHAMMER... CAMERA WIDENS TO REVEA
ON A GROUP OF VICIOUS LOOKING BALD BIKER TYPES...
AT THE TOP OF THE TOWER
BACK ON FURIOUS, RAJA, AND SHOVELER -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a tangled jungle of razor wire, fina COMING INTO VIEW of a foreboding, fortress-like old  institution, surrounded by towers and gun turrets.  Screa and horrible laughter is heard from within... CLOSE ON a sign that reads "Erie Hospital for the Crimina Insane" ...This is where the worst killers and psychos go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA PANS THE EXPRESSIONLESS FACES of the REVIEW BO as CASANOVA FRANKENSTEIN sits across from them.  Dressed an immaculately tailored prison smock (with "Casanova"  exquisitely embroidered above the pocket), he sits contri as DOCTOR EMMET BIERCE, the hospital's fatherly Chief of  Psychiatry, presents his case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can deny the horrendous nature  of Mr. Frankenstein's crimes, but in  the twenty years he has been with  us, I have never seen a patient turn  his energies to more productive use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASANOVA, the picture of remorse and repentance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at his accomplishments...  three volumes of poetry, two rock  operas, a sculpture garden, four  romance novels... and who can forget  his touching portrayal of Billy  Bigelow in our all-psychotic  production of "Carousel"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SEVERAL OF THE BOARD getting misty eyed at the memory that brilliant performance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directed by our own Doctor Anabel  Leek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON DOCTOR ANABEL LEEK, the hospital's icily beautiful, ul cool, top shrink. A moment later Casanova addresses them... His manner is  charming, sincere, his voice soft, filled with emotion. is a master of seduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago I was a lost soul.  Loveless... (with a son-like glance  at Doctor Bierce) Fatherless... (chokes on the word) A... psycho! (breaks down sobbing) Oh!  How could I have done it? The  murder... the mayhem... all of those  lovely young girls! (weeping, a brilliant  performance) I'm sorry! I'm SO SO SORRY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Bierce wipes the tears from his eyes. Reactions fr the board, moved, as Casanova weeps convulsively.  Doctor Leek shows no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls himself together) But my deeds have been done, and my  youth is gone, and we can only go  forward in this cruel world... and  if I have learned anything from my  wretched life it is that... When you  walk through a storm, keep your head  held high... (singing) And don't be afraid of the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears plop dawn the cheeks of the review board as the FUL

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A hand stamps Casanova's file "CURED"... Casanova shakes  hands and embraces the tearful members of the review boar finishing with a paternal hug from Doctor Bierce. In his cell a guard delivers Casanova his favorite old di suit (that's been waiting far him for twenty years). Casanova, dressed in the suit, walks down the central ais of the lock-up... A moment later he steps out of the mass gates of the hospital, and takes his first deep breath of freedom... while in an office window high above Bierce an the members of the review board stand watching, very prou But suddenly THE MUSIC CHANGES TO SEVENTIES DISCO as a bl Ferrari drives up, and Doctor Leek, now dressed very sexi gets out... As the review board watches in stunned silenc Casanova and Anabel perform a nifty little disco twirl,  finishing with a very lewd kiss... Bierce, watching, realizes he's been duped... as Casanova grinning up at him, puts a long gold chain (his favorite  weapon) around his neck... Bierce, horrified, picks up the telephone... as Casanova Anabel get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova and Anabel drive off. The massive old hospital i seen through the rear window behind them, as Casanova cal looks at his watch...

dialogues.speaker: HIS WATCH -
dialogues.text: as the second hand just swings toward the twelve. It is  exactly twelve noon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost wistfully) Boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the hospital EXPLODES in a HUGE FIREBALL that complet consumes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those gas leaks can be murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari drives past and the CAMERA HOLDS ON a sign th reads "We1come to Champion City, home of Captain Amazing" The city itself, a crumbling rust belt metropolis (ala  Detroit) can be seen stretched out along the shore of Lak Champion off in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm home.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE ROAD
dialogues.text: The Ferrari drives under a much larger billboard that loo over the road, showing a picture of Captain Amazing himse a square jawed classic superhero, staring fiercely into t camera. The caption reads "Crime. Don't even think about  it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letters read "Six months later"... as the CAMERA EXPLORES the desolate muddy terrain of the train yards, CRUISING p piles of tires and abandoned train cars... CAMERA PICKS UP a battered van as it drives through the y then pulls up beside an old boxcar. The back of the van i thrown open, a ramp is thrown down, and THE RED EYES, a g of vicious small time thieves (all of whom wear sunglasse with red lenses) start unloading their night's haul... RE EYE 1 drives a golf cart, with clubs, down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golf anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several more Red Eyes emerge carrying a sawn off bike rac with bikes still attached, a barber pole, a Virgin Mary l statue, and a top of the line baby stroller... while thei leader, BIG RED, stands in the door to the boxcar, watchi approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad night's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said crime don't pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Eyes laugh... as Red Eye 3 takes the cover off th baby stroller and sees... that there's a BABY still in it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Boss, we got a stowaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crooks gather around the baby, a jolly little kid who just laughs at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to slug him) Who you laughin' at, punk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a tyke. Lighten up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's kinda cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you like drool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why don't we sell him back to  his parents? For a million bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others think that's a great idea, but Big Red doesn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if he rats on us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others hadn't thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what should we do with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick a brick in his Pampers and  dump him in the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others think that's a good idea and look around for a brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, kid, you're goin' for a  swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But suddenly there is another presence... A man in a blue turban and cape with the initials "BR" on his chest has  appeared... He is THE BLUE RAJA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast, gentlemen -- and I use  the term loosely... Unhand that  youngster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another man steps into the light. He wears a construction helmet and mask. There is an "S" on his chest, and he car an old shovel. He is THE SHOVELER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you're mulch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brandishes his shovel for effect. The Red Eyes look at these two, highly amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys supposed to be...  superheroes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third man steps out. His costume is less dramatic than others. He wears only an old leather jacket and a faded, torn shi with flames on it, but the fierce look on his face and th atrociousness of his haircut make it very clear that he i the craziest and most dangerous of the three. He is MISTE FURIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ARE superheroes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Did you mother make those  costumes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crooks howl with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our territory. Beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over YOUR dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Red turns to the others and shakes with pretended fea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0ooooo, he's scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Eyes laugh, but suddenly, a small silver projecti whizzes through the air and implants itself in Big Red's  backside. He howls with pain, pulls it out and examines i It's a silver dessert fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fork!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Raja holds up his hands, each of which hold a spread silver forks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's plenty more where that  came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Red gives a shrill whistle, and a dozen more Red Eyes step out of an old caboose... including MIKEY, a four hun pound behemoth. He is eating a container of Ben and Jerry like it was an ice cream cone, taking huge bites out of i container and all. RAJA AND SHOVELER, reacting... Gulp. This was more than t bargained for. But Furious just growls; he's game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET 'EM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Eyes attack... Mister Furious goes into a furious face; his hair stands out straight and he rushes right in the oncoming crooks... A Red Eye takes a swing at the Shoveler -- but he simply  puts up his shovel and lets the crook slug the shovel's p The crook yelps with pain and shakes his battered hand... the Raja fends off crooks, poking them with salad forks.. and the baby sits in his stroller, watching and laughing, really enjoying the show. (There's no real martial artist or teamwork here; this is a classic back alley brouhaha.) But there's too many of then... The Raja goes down under  swinging fists... and so does the Shoveler... Furious holds his own, taking out crooks with powerful le and rights -- until Mikey runs him down like a truck, fal right on top of him and crushing him under his massive we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crush him, Mikey!... Mash him!...  Mush him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible under  all that meat) Is that all you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants more!... Squish him!...  Finish him off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faintly) Your mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey, sweating, bears down... but suddenly, a calm, very authoritative voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything suddenly stops, as the Red Eyes look up and se CAPTAIN AMAZING standing on tap of the boxcar, hands on h framed in the light at the moon, his biceps bulging, his  state of the art physique sculpted body armor gleaming in the moonlight, his cape wafting heroically in the wind. H is superhero perfection incarnate. ON THE RED EYES as their viciousness turns instantly to  panic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S CAPTAIN AMAZING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Red and a couple others try to run for it, but Amazin leaps cat-like off the boxcar and is on them in a flash. the baby claps his hands in delight, and our three heroes watch in beat-up awe, Amazing deftly takes out the crooks with expert punches and effortlessly delivered elbows and kicks. He is the consumate superhero, and he doesn't even break a sweat. The remaining Red Eyes drop to their knees and throw up t hands in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We give!... We're sorry!... We had  terrible childhoods! (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars and a TV truck come screeching into the train yard... and the scene is suddenly flooded with light and  swarming with cops and reporters... Our three heroes try to approach Captain Amazing (who sti looks fresh as a daisy).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Amazing just walks past them, ignoring them completel as if they didn't even exist. He goes to greet DAWN WONG  (Champion City's answer to Connie Chung).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on the old  superhero charm) Hi. Dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putty in his hands,  pudding in his bowl) Looks like you've done it again,  Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes just watch, feeling ignored, humiliated. Furio growls. Suddenly, TWO COPS are accosting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, show's over. Move it. On your  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Officers. You don't  understand -- we're superheroes, and  we just busted up this gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Let me guess -- you're Towel  Head and he's... (meaning the Shoveler) Captain Pooper Scooper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops crack up. Furious growls at them. The cops yank their nightsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And leave crime fighting to the real  thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoveler and Raja pull Furious away before he gets into r trouble... The cops watch as our three heroes disappear into the nig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wannabes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inner city greasy spoon.

dialogues.speaker: A TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: on which Captain Amazing, the laughing baby in his arms, being interviewed by Dawn Wong. He's playing the cutsy ph op for all its worth, gootchy-gooing the kid, etc. Dawn i creaming. Our three heroes sit at a booth in the back of the diner, watching the tube...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nursing a sore jaw) He doesn't miss a trick, does he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a jerk -- and like nobody knows  who he really is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't start that again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious picks up the newspaper on which there is a photo a good looking guy in a tux at a benefit... The headline  reads "Lance Hunt Hosts Benefit." He holds the picture up next to the television, so the faces of Lance Hunt and Ca Amazing are side by side. It is obviously the same guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Lance Hunt! Just take off the  glasses -- and it's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a vague similarity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vague similarity? IT'S THE SAME  GUY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (downing some aspirin) Oh, who gives a damn who he is? I  can't take this anymore. Night after  night we're on the streets, busting  our humps -- and for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take the licks and he gets the  chicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you have to chase a dream  before you realize it's not gonna  happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a break, that's all! Nobody'd  ever heard of him until he busted  Casanova Frankenstein!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But look at him... and look at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera loves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depressed silence. Furious turns his attention to the n dispenser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Why do they always fill stuff these  things so full you can't pull 'em  out without ripping 'em! (rips one out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost another fork tonight. She's  getting suspicious, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you just tell her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Because I can't! Okay? She wouldn't  understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone. She's his mother,  not yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had an off night, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when are we gonna have an on night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS is standing at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at her, taken aback. She's very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my first night. My name's Monica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON FURIOUS, smitten by her, but almost afraid to lo at her. Under all that rage, he's in fact shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys going to a costume party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're superheroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Like Captain Amazing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you famous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're like... struggling  superheroes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We prefer to think of ourselves as  unsung... I am the Blue Raja, Master  of Silverware... (does a very impressive  little flipping thing  with his place setting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these are my associates, the  Shoveler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mister Furious... His anger is  his power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued by Furious) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually a superpower is a magical  endowment or a great skill. In his  case, it's entirely emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burgers all around. (meaning himself) Medium. (meaning the Shoveler) Rare. (meaning Furious) Raw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later as Monica walks away, Furious can't help b watch her. The Raja replaces the diner's dinnerware with good stuff from his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy, when was the last time you had  an actual date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting very pissed  off) What does it matter? Women just want  to control you -- and talk about  their feelings. They want to know  why you're angry all the time -- and  what can they can do to help -- so  you tell them there's nothing --  nothing -- just leave me alone --  but they bug you and they bug you  and they bug you -- until you just  can't stand it anymore! -- so you  finally open up -- you pop like a  blister -- and it all comes spewing  out -- all your emotions -- your  feelings -- your fears -- all of it! (after a beat) And then they dump you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're chicken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fiercely) Who's chicken? (gets up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica stands at the counter placing her order. Furious  approaches her, leans against the counter. For a moment h just stands there, fuming, unable to think of anything to say. She isn't sure what to make of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it piss you off the way the  when you really want to talk to  somebody you can't think of anything  to say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess... Are you always so angry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I'm awake... You busy after  work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go out and get drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's visibly turned off by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight. (picks up an order  and walks away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, the Raja, and the Shoveler step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should try a more romantic  approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets on his old Harley) Like what? Cutting off my own ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious kicks his engine started and speeds off into the  night as the Shoveler opens the door of his battered Ford Esquire station wagon, and the Raja gets into his ancient Datsun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shoveler pulls into the driveway of his very modest h The front yard looks like a battle zone. Bikes and kids'  junk are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: as big a disaster area as the front yard. His kids, EDDIE JR. (15), LENORE (12), BUTCH (10), TRACY (7), and ROLAND are all sprawled in front of the television. The Shoveler enters, and his kids don't even bother to look up from th tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, when are you guys gonna clean  this place up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right -- like that will ever happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save any babies lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SHOVELER, silent, hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster than a speeding turtle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More powerful than a deodorant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Able to eat twelve donuts in a single  sitting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, snoring in his chair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the john --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... Supergut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all laugh (in that derisive way that kids do so  well) as the Shoveler dejectedly walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shoveler enters, dejected. His wife, Lucille, is doin the dishes. She looks up, sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feels for him) Rough night, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Raja's Datsun is parked in front of a neat as a pin l Victorian house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. Someone is sneaking around. A drawer is quietly opened, and we hear the gentle clink of silver.  Suddenly, the light goes on and we see the Blue Raja, now dressed in a sport shirt and slacks, with his hand in the drawer. His MOTHER, in her nightclothes, stands by the do where she has just switched on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in the silver  drawer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for... the TV Guide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him, very suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'm such a fool... Thanks,  Mummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed. He kisses her and goes into the next room. CAMERA HOLDS O MOM; she doesn't trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A billboard overlooking the city. Captain Amazing is pose wearing a pair of bright blue Nikes. The caption reads. " a nice world. Somebody's got to save it... The Nike Super It's Amazing." Furious sits on his Harley, taking long hauls from a pint bottle of cheap bourbon and gazing up at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing? What's so amazing about  him? I'd be amazing, too, if I'd  inherited two hundred million bucks...  or two bucks... or two cents... (hurls the empty  bottle, smashing it  against the sign) Who am I kidding? Dreams don't come  true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of despondency, and then he hears a strange soun overhead and looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as something suddenly flies across the star filled night above him... It is Captain Amazing, wearing a high tech rocket pack on his back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going? (kicks his Harley  started)

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: as Furious, following Captain Amazing, rides roughshod do the steep hill, skidding onto a road and then speeding th a residential area... He cuts onto some railroad tracks, hops his bike up on a  rail, and rides smoothly along it, following Amazing... H turns off the tracks, rides roughly through some woods, t emerges from the trees and sees.. A foreboding looking old mansion... Captain Amazing lands the highest part of its roof... Furious pulls up, gazes a the front gates of the mansion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letters across the iron gates read... "Frankenstein".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Amazing abandons his jet pack and moves across th old slate roof like Spiderman, leaping nimbly from gable gable and walking along a high ridge like a tight rope wa Finally he approaches a skylight, looks down and sees... A huge old library with an iron catwalk running around it Casanova Frankenstein sits in a club chair by a roaring f Anabel perches on the arm of his chair. In the other chai sits a once good looking, now paunchy guy, with a meticul coifed haircut. He is TONY POMPADOUR, head of the infamou Disco Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just as he suspected) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees that the skylight is open, and quietly lets himse in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova and Tony P savor glasses of brandy and puff on b cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you enjoy these cigars. I had  to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you considered my offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Mr. F, me and the boys  always loved workin' for you. You  had such style: the clothes, the  dancin', the elegant way you'd snuff  a babe. You were the King...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova accepts this graciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But times have changed, and you been  in that bug house a long tine. I can  see you still got the style, but I  dunno for sure you still got the  edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Captain Amazing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova and Tony P look up and see Captain Amazing, pose noncalantly on the iron catwalk, gazing down at them. Ton jumps out of his chair, scared. But Casanova just smiles his ancient rival, cool as a cucumber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come. I left that  skylight open for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you knew I'd know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But did you know I knew you'd know  I'd know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony P makes a move for his pistol, but Captain Amazing  instantly whips out his pistol, getting the drop on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hate to waste a good bullet on a  piece of scum like you, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jig is up, Casanova. I've spent  six months watching you, and know  exactly what you're up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that you're recruiting your  old henchmen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous reaction from Tony P.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who your girlfriend really  is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Icy reaction from Anabel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know the terrible revenge that  you plan to inflict on this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you know just about  everything, don't you, Lance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for one little thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (supremely confident) And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I've hot wired the city's entire  power supply through that catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova suddenly throws a secret breaker switch, and the ugly hum of a million volts instantly fills the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still watching... as all the lights in the house go out,  except for a frightening orange glow in an upper room... Off in the distance Furious sees... the lights of the ent city flicker and then black out... A moment later the man and the city's lights return to normal... as Furious watc not sure what to make of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is snarled. Horns are blasting. Tempers are fraye

dialogues.speaker: A HAMMERING JACKHAMMER... CAMERA WIDENS TO REVEA
dialogues.text: that it is being operated by the Shoveler, dressed in wor clothes. Wiped out from the night before, the vibrations the hamer are lulling him off to sleep... He nods out... his BOSS whacks him on the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YO! CAPTAIN SOMINEX! Get your shut- eye at home, or you'll be a full  time superhero!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Raja lies sprawled on his bed, depressed, still in hi pee jays, as he watches... an ANTHONY ROBBINS infomercial THE TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all within your power. The only  thing that's in your way is YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An auto junkyard and demotion yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant press mashes an old car... while nearby Mister Fu does the job by hand, demolishing an old Grand Prix with iron bar. He does it as easily as a normal guy would tear apart a corrugated box, ripping off the doors, then teari off the bumpers and the hood and tossing the pieces onto big pile... His big boned, red faced boss SALLY is callin out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Roy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a weedy overgrown far corner of the junkyard Sally and Furious stand looking a big old hunk of a military vehicl It is a Herkimer Battle Jitney, a heavily armored, window soundproof, personnel carrier (designed by the Pentagon in the fifties to take congress on battlefield fact finding tours). Overgrown with weeds, home to an extended family of pigeons, its fighting days it ever had any) are over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times I gotta tell you about  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, that's a Herkimer Battle  Jitney! They don't make 'em like  that anymore. It's a classic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hunk of junk. I want the iron.  Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away. Furious growls. He picks up his iron bar is about to wedge it under the front bumper of the Herkim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the big old headlights and the sad old grill seem to looking at hint, imploring him for one last chance... And he just can't do it. He throws away his iron bar and  climbs inside the cab of the Herkimer...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAB
dialogues.text: Furious sits behind the wheel and tenderly touches its be up old dashboard, then turns on the radio, which, miracul still works. He tunes in a local station, puts his feet up on the dash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and continues to deny any knowledge  of the incident... In local news,  millionaire Lance Hunt has apparently  disappeared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FURIOUS, taking immediate notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members at his household told police  that the playboy philanthropist failed  to return home last night after "going  out for a walk". Police say they  have no reason yet to suspect foul  play, but a search is under way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, the Shoveler, and the Raja all sit at their boot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him go in -- and he didn't  come out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't know for sure it's the  same guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV -
dialogues.text: Casanova is being interviewed by DON STOUFFER, the local  Mike Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Don, I've done some terrible  things in my life, but now I'm cured,  and I just want to give back something  to my old home town... That's why  I'm using what's left of my fortune  to build...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MODEL of a huge concrete bunker-like instituti structure (i.e. the Getty).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frankenstein Center for the Arts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've changed, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the wall of the estate... as our heroes' three heads rise over it... and survey the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to climb over) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper, holding  him back) Wait!... Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of men are hanging around the door to the house,  smoking, chatting, and laughing. A CLOSER ANGLE REVEALS t they are all dressed in the height (or depths) of seventi disco fashion. One of them is showing off some steps. Our heroes fall back behind the safety of the wall and co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Disco Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most vicious gang of thugs this  city ever produced. Twenty years ago  they were Casanova's personal  bodyguard. But after he was busted  they crawled into the woodwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they've crawled back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may be getting in over our heads  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks like a job for Superman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Batman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys get it? If Captain  Amazing is still in there, we can  rescue him -- and get on TV! (goes right over the  wall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share an exasperated look, then scramble over the wa after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova and Dr. Anabel Leek are preparing for bed. Anabe sits in front of a huge mirror, brushing her long hair as Casanova moves up behind her and puts his hands around he throat, massaging, squeezing, just barely resisting the  temptation to strangle her. (She loves it).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going exactly as we  planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts the sharp point  of her comb handle  under his chin) Not quite. You haven't announced our  engagement yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have slipped my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mind is so slippery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Pootchkie. My womanizing  days are over. You're my Lady Macbeth,  my Imelda... my Nicole. (pulls her into his  arms) We're such an incredible team. Who  could possibly stop us? (kisses her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they crunch their way non too stealthily across the  backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't crunch the leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a Mohican. (bumps into a lawn  chair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. (They all stop.) I hear something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all listen; there is a low rushing sound... It is th sound of water rushing through pipes. Suddenly, the lawn  sprinklers all pop up... and our heroes get drenched. The duck off the lawn, behind the cover of a large tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm soaked. (sneezes) Oh great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a Mohican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious sees a pair of French doors, off a small patio. O of the doors is slightly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start sneaking toward it, but as they cross the pati they trip the automatic security lighting, and suddenly f themselves bathed in light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As our heroes look around as a dozen Disco Boys, armed wi pipes, chains, brass knuckles, step into the light and  encircle them... The French doors open and Tony P steps o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'm sorry. We must have the wrong  house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Disco Boys attack. The Raja is instantly clubbed down The Shoveler deflects only a blow or two with his shovel  before he goes down, too... These guys are not the Red Ey Only Furious holds his own. He grabs a pipe away from one them and swings fiercely, keeping the others off. Suddenl the Disco Boys pull back. Furious doesn't know why, until turns and sees... Casanova, standing right behind him, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a cat-like move Casanova slashes his gold chain vici and repeatedly -- across Furious' face. Furious, stunned  with pain, lunges at Casanova, who neatly steps aside, th catches him with a fast combination of spinning disco kic Finally he lassos the chain around Furious' neck, and pul it tight, strangling him. ON THE DISCO BOYS, watching, snapping their fingers with  admiration... Casanova releases Furious, who slumps to the ground. Casa steps away, and the Disco Boys gather around Furious and  kick him viciously... as Casanova and Tony P watch, amuse chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superheroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I kill them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely disdainful) Why bother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Disco Boys drag our heroes through the gate and throw them like bags of garbage into the street... where they l in a moaning, agonized, semi-conscious heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, rubbing his neck; a thin red mark runs around it The three of them are sitting at their usual table, in ve bad shape, moaning and groaning... Monica approaches. She made them ice packs and cold compresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go. (sits with them,  applies a compress  to the Raja's head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you guys ought to forget this  Superhero stuff and join Kiwanis or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FUSSY CUSTOMER is calling out from another table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still furious) Are you serious? This is the break  we've been waiting for!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have the famous superheroes got  that we don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archenemies! Casanova isn't just a  criminal -- he's a supervillain.  Stopping him could be our ticket to  fame, fortune -- and babes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it would be the right thing to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissively) Yeah yeah -- and that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's only three of us, and  he's got the entire brotherhood of  evil at his disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe it's time for us to form  our own brotherhood... a brotherhood  of righteous, crime fighting, skull  cracking, Disco Boy bashing, warriors  of the night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm liking this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we send out the word -- and  summon all of the unsung superheroes  we know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Yeah, but... who do we know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take a long moment to ponder this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... there's the Spleen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoveler and Raja make disgusted noises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this cousin. He's a real doofus,  but he claims he can become invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I see him if he's invisible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's the Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a legendary masked Mexican crime  fighting superwrestler and master of  the machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's sure that he actually exists,  but they say he can be contacted by  leaving a message on a crumpled up  napkin at the Tacky Taco down by the  bus station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funky Mexican restaurant by the bus station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes, in normal clothing, have just finished a taco lunch. Furious is writing a message on a napkin with a  ballpoint pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure that's how you spell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOTE -
dialogues.text: which reads "Spinks, we need you." They crumple up the napkin and leave the restaurant... A  moment later a shy looking MEXICAN MAN busses their tray. but in A CLOSE ANGLE we see him secretly pocket the napki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little brick house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teenage boy's room, decorated to the max with models an posters of the great superheroes: Batman, Spiderman, Capt Amazing, etc. INVISIBLE BOY, about fifteen, is being  interviewed by the Raja, Mister Furious, and the Shoveler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, let me get this straight. You  have the power to become invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... only when no one is looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone looks at you, you  immediately become visible again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're only invisible... to  yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully) No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I look at myself, I become visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're only invisible, when  absolutely no one is looking at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you know that you've ever  been invisible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes are less than impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, kid, we've got a lot of heroes  to interview --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) I know I haven't got it entirely  worked out yet, but I've always  dreamed of becoming a superhero...  Weren't you guys ever a kid? Didn't  you ever need someone to just give  you a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON OUR HEROES, looking around the room... and softening u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes sit at their usual table along with Invisible and a weird looking guy in a greasy, stained yellow super outfit. Across his chest in falling off stick on letters reads "THE SPLEEN", and that's exactly who he is. Furious the Raja, and Shoveler sit as far away from him as possib He is a totally noxious, hyperactive person... and he is  thrilled to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy I can't tell you how thrilled I  was when you guys called -- You gonna  eat that pickle? (sucks it in) I've always dreamed of being a member  of the a real superhero team -- and  to have friends -- real friends -- I  mean guys I could live with -- sleep  with -- die with -- eat with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the mustard dispenser to his lips and squeezes it straight into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love mustard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Raja, and the Shoveler react; they can't believe they've actually invited this guy to join their group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what exactly is your superpower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when I was a kid I grew up on  Love Canal -- remember that? -- and  my brothers and I used to go swimming  in it -- make Kool-Aid out of it --  stuff like that. Anyway my brothers  all died, but I lived, and I grew  all these like weird organs that  have never been seen in humans before.  So now I can do things like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over the table and lets just a little tiny drop spittle dribble onto the table...

dialogues.speaker: THE TABLE -
dialogues.text: as the spittle burns a hole in the Formica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spleen inadvertently gives the tiniest little burp, a our three heroes duck out of the way or under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!... Look out!... Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people in the next booth give a cry of revulsion, put their hands to their mouths, and immediately leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why don't you just put a cork  in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried that once. The cork melted.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: Our heroes mull their situation over coffee. Monica fresh their cups. The Spleen squirts mustard in his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just not enough of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we know they're out there.  Hundreds -- maybe thousands of lonely,  unknown superheroes, who desperately  need a cause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a social life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how do we get to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obscene phone calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ignore that suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you throw a barbecue? (moves off to another  table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON OUR HEROES, realizing that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invisible Boy sits at the desk in his room, writing immac little notes on small file cards. (He's made a whole pile them.)

dialogues.speaker: THE NOTE -
dialogues.text: which reads "Got superpowers? Want to fight evil? Then JO US and let's PARTY HEARTY! Beer! Burgers! Babes!"

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: as our heroes post these notes all over the city, in plac where lonely superheroes night find them... The Raja posts a note on the door of a comic book store.. The Shoveler posts a note on the bulletin board at a bowl alley... Mr. Furious tapes the note to the cracked glass of a  vandalized phone booth... At an abandoned drive-in movie theater... Invisible Boy w through the empty lot, taping a note to each of the old  speaker posts... A White Castle hamburger joint... Inside the pay toilet S is scratching something on the wall with a nail. He stops and admires his handiwork, and we see that he has engrave the entire message on the wall... END MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, typical working class backyard. A round, aluminu above ground pool. A Weber grill with burgers on it. Unop packages of hamburger rolls. An old Vic Damon record play on a boom box. The Spleen floats around on a rubber raft the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in! The water's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, the water is turning a yellowish green... The re of our heroes sit around on cheap folding chairs. No  superheroes have shown up. The Shoveler, at the grill, se burgers to his kids, who stand in line waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy on the sarcasm) Great picnic, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big turnout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these guys real superheroes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids scoff... A moment later they head back to the ho with their burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where's Captain Amazing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't be caught dead here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go into the house. No one says anything. The Shovele just stares at the burgers on the grill. Vic Damon sings. Furious chugs his beer; he's working himself into a reall morose mood. ON THE SPLEEN, munching on a chlorine tablet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, these pool mints are delicious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raja looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there was traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are we kidding? No one's gonna  show. We're living in a fantasy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys -- we're fighting  against evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good or evil, what's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to believe that. Now I'm not  so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy, remember, it is all within your  power. The only thing that's in your  way... is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there is a knock at the gate. Everyone immediat perks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later they open the gate and see... HALF A DOZEN BURLY GUYS wearing various superhero outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, is this the superhero  wingding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. Come on in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Party! (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first glance these guys seem promising... but their ou are decidedly improvised: weird goggles and sunglasses, s curtain capes, baseball caps with beer cans on them. Thei leader holds a squeegee with a long handle... Furious is  suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Blue Raja, Master of  Silverware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Squeegee Man, and these are my  compadres, the Invincible Dudes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Invincible Dudes spot the keg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Brews! Party! (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go immediately to the keg and start filling beer cup and guzzling them down. The Raja tries to hand out some f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind filling out these  forms; names, addresses, description  of superpowers, that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, dude. No problem. (Etc.) (but they just toss  the forms away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FURIOUS, watching, starting to get pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, like where are the babes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It said on the card there'd be babes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually we lied about the babes,  but there's plenty of burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's false advertising!... We came  all the way from South Champion,  man! We coulda gone plinking!... We  coulda gone bunqee jumping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No babes. No peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chanting) No babes -- no peace! No babes -- no  peace! No babes -- no peace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's trash the place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, fed up, confronts Squeegee Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're a superhero, what's your  power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Squeegee Man. (holding it out  threateningly) Touch my squeegee... and you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Invincible Dudes are cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Squeegee Man comes flying -- and screaming -- over the fence, landing none too gracefully in the front yard. A beat and his squeegee come flying out after him. Anothe beat and the Invincible Dudes come running out the gate i panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here!... That dude's  crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take off down the street, running right past a woman carrying a bowling ball bag and dressed in a faded, threa old rayon superhero costume with a decidedly fifties flav She is THE BOWLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes sit around the patio, dejected, miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up, see her standing there, and aren't quite su what to make of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Bowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bowler? I remember him from when  I was a kid. He was killed years  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, honey, being a superhero...  it's a guy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her bowling ball and spins it on the tip of her finger (like a Harlem Globetrotter). For a long moment sh just looks at them, smiling. ON THE OTHERS watching, almost mesmerized by the spinning ball... Suddenly, she gives an ear splitting battle cry and start swinging the ball around her in wide ferocious arcs, like cannibal with a war club -- or a twirler on meth, going s fast she almost becomes a blur... Then, just as suddenly, she stops, aims and rolls her bal It shoots straight through Invisible Boy's legs...

dialogues.speaker: ON A NEATLY PLACED COLLECTION OF PLASTER LAWN DWARVES -
dialogues.text: as the ball smashes into then, pulverizing them... It goe into a reverse spin, passes through Invisible Boy's legs  again, and returns to the Bowler who is holding its bag o for it... The ball rolls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON OUR HEROES, left absolutely speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it could zip up its own bag, then  you'd be impressed, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks out. Our heroes share an amazed look, then run after her...

dialogues.speaker: JUST OUTSIDE THE GATE
dialogues.text: walking away... as Furious catches up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Can I buy you a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd never ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his arm and they all start to walk back into th Shoveler's backyard... but the CAMERA PANS ACROSS THE STR to the dark place between two houses, where a MAN WEARING STRANGE STEEL MASK with a frightening, impassively powerf expression stands in the deep shadows, watching them in  motionless, predatory silence. We do not know who he is, we cannot tell if he is good or evil.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE BARBECUE
dialogues.text: A FADED OLD SNAPSHOT of the original "The Bowler" holding little girl in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was more than just a superhero...   He was my father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others, touched by this, have gathered around the Bow who is holding the old snapshot in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then one day, he didn't come  home. The police said it was an  accident. But cargo containers don't  just fall on people. He was  murdered... After that I fell apart.  I dropped out of school, became a  mud wrestler, married and divorced a  jerk. When my mother died I hit  bottom... but then, when I was  cleaning out her attic, I found my  father's old bowling bag and costume,  almost like he'd left them there for  me... and I knew what I had to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who killed him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Disco Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something? Those guys are  really starting TO PISS ME OFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's still only six of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SO WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two more than the Fantastic  Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a Dirty Dozen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice the Three Stooges!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And only one short of the Magnificent  Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can't count Horst Buckholtz  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was cute though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they all had one thing we haven't  got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girlfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name. All the great superhero teams  have got a fabulous name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all think about it for a moment. You can almost smel their brains overheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about... the Savage Six?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inscrutable Six?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Six Pistols?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Exterminators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Obliterators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eradicators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emasculators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- I got it!... The Spleen Team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets beaned by a couple of empty soda cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To hell with a name. Let's get to  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC UP as Furious stands and starts out. The others sta and follow him... as our heroes form up for their first H GROUP SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as A LITTLE OLD LADY crosses the street,  when suddenly she looks up and sees a pair of headlights  coming on fast. An immaculately maintained seventies limo heading straight for her.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LIMO
dialogues.text: Disco Boys sit in the front. Casanova, Anabel, and Tony P sit in the back, dressed for a night on the town... There is a thud as the limo hits the old lady, and everyo in the car explodes into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little old lady. That's a hundred  points!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE/OUTSIDE THE LIMO
dialogues.text: as the limo drives past a billboard with an ad for "MILK" with a milk mustached Captain Amazing looking at the came

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows your every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony P imitates a massive electrical convulsion, and the  villains crack up. But as they pass the billboard, a pair of headlights  illuminate in its shadows, and the Shoveler's Ford Esquir pulls out and follows.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ESQUIRE
dialogues.text: The Shoveler is driving. Mister Furious sits in the front seat next to him, and our other heroes are packed into th back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say hello.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE/OUTSIDE THE TWO CARS
dialogues.text: As the limo stops at a traffic light... and the Esquire p up alongside it. For a moment good and evil stare each ot down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not these guys again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Disco Boys howl with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The D Boys laugh. Furious stares at Casanova, and Casanov stares right back at him, as cool as a snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with Captain Amazing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spots the Bowler) Hey, in the backseat, who are you  supposed to be, the Bowler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His daughter? Well guess what,  sweetheart? I'm the one who squished  your Daddy. And he squished real  good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The villains laugh, and Mister Furious EXPLODES INTO RAGE He swings open his car door, mashing it into the limo and leaving a big dent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'SCUSE ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts punching the limo like it's a punching bag --  putting big dents in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony and the boys all reach into their coats for their pi but as they yank them out, the Spleen sticks his head out the station wagon, puts his face right up to the open win of the limo and lets loose with a TREMENDOUS BELCH... As the villains choke and gag in the noxious fumes, Miste Furious goes on a DEMOLITION RAMPAGE, working his way aro the limo, punching big dents with his fists, breaking the windows with his head, flattening the tires by kicking th knocking off the rear view mirror with the back of his ha Then he leaps up on top of the limo... While inside the villains gasp for air as big dents are  stomped into the roof above them... ANGLE THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD as Furious leaps down onto t hood, and gazes in at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I check your oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plunges his hand through the metal of the hood, pulls the car's dip stick, and checks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the dip stick away, then leaps off JUST AS Tony gets off a shot, EXPLODING the windshield of the limo. Furious lands safely on the hood of the station wagon. As the Shoveler throws the Esquire into gear, Furious shouts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICE CAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our heroes streak off into the night... Casanova and others stagger out of the demolished limo, sucking in the clean air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed by Furious) That boy's got talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm gonna nip it in the bud.

dialogues.speaker: A DARKENED ALLEY -
dialogues.text: where the man in the strange steel mask can be seen...  watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very typical, nondescript neighborhood place...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: Our heroes stand at the bar, celebrating their first vict

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever our name is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They toast and drink.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: The Spleen is passed out at a table, snoring. Shoveler an Invisible Boy sit next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even his snores smell bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raja and Bowler sit at the bar, deep in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's your mother. You gotta  tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad thinks all this superhero stuff  is a stupid waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he plays golf, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her only son, and she always had  such high hopes for me. Medicine.  Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're a superhero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cape. The turban. She wouldn't  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... My girlfriends all dumped  me after I put on the mask. They  thought I'd lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in fact... you'd found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink their glasses and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your dream... and you can't  ever give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spleen makes weird noises in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what he dreams about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Furious sits alone in the corner, brooding, lost in h own angry thoughts..

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: A black van drives slowly past the bar.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VAN
dialogues.text: The van is packed with Disco Boys. Tony P sits in the fro seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has spotted the Ford Esquire parked in the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. I'm headin' home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Invisible Boy) Come on, Junior, it's a school night.

dialogues.speaker: JUST OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: As our heroes, carrying the Spleen, leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody up for a little White Castle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But suddenly the world is a whirling sass of chains and c as they are bushwhacked by the Disco Boys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he comes to with a groan and sees... the Bowler and  Invisible Boy tied up and gagged, with the Raja, Shoveler and the Spleen trussed up right next to them. Furious loo up, sees Tony P standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, cutie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious struggles, but he has been secured with some very heavy tire chains. Tony P takes out a large caliber revol flips it open to make sure it's loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six losers. Six bullets. Perfect...  Got any last words, Angry Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco sucks. Very good. You know  what I'm gonna do, Angry Boy, since  you're so colorful? I'm gonna save  you for last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and points the pistol right at Invisible Boy's h Furious struggles against his chains -- to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, punk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invisible Boy closes his eyes... Tony P cocks the pistol. But suddenly, there is the ring of steel -- a broad blade sweeps through the air, and Tony P's pistol is sliced nea in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding half a pistol) HOLY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is the strange steel mask is standing there, the  drawn machete still in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenos naches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Disco Boys rush the newcomer, but he slices through t baseball bats with his machete, and sends them reeling an crashing into each other with expert forearm blows, whack with the flat of his blade, and head butts with his mask. Furious struggles to break free and join the fight, but t chains are too strong... and the stranger doesn't need an help. Tony P flicks open a big switchblade and lunges at the  stranger, who sidesteps him like a matador and swings his machete at him. Tony P turns, about to charge again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mexican accent) Would you like me to trim the sides?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony P feels the top of his head, and realizes that the b from the machete has neatly sliced off the top his disco- leaving only stubble on the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) LET'S GET OUTTA HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony and the Disco Boys run for it... Furious and the others study their masked savior, who sta before them, machete in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his machete above Furious' head... and then sli clean through the chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes have gathered around a scrap wood fire in a st drum. They sit on the ground and on old car seats, feelin like schmucks as the Sphinx chews them out, his mask look very frightening and magical in the flickering light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call yourselves superheroes? A  rooster fights more intelligently  than you! You have shown yourself to  your enemy and revealed your powers  to him -- and what have you  accomplished for this? You have  destroyed his car. Brilliant! If you  want to survive you must fight like  a wolf pack -- not like a six pack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious sulks, but the others get the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolf is cunning. He knows that  stealth is his greatest weapon, and  he always fights as a team... (at Furious) Not like some drunken Tejano on  Saturday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious grunts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casanova Frankenstein is a a master  of evil. You will need more than  shovels and dessert forks to stop  him... What else have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) So what else has Superman got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the fact that he's Superman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets bounce off him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious sulks again, feeling that the others are turning  against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firepower costs money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody got any?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't think this through very  well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) My father had this friend... He was  an inventor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes stand looking at an old farmhouse. The place i an absolute wreck. It hasn't been painted in twenty-five  years. Windows are boarded up. Half the shingles are gone There's visible fire damage around the kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he's still lives here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he's still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the last time I saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is about to knock, but the door is suddenly yanked op and an eighty year old guy is standing there. He's got a  wild head of white hair (that looks like a living explosi and he wears a stained old lab coat with stickum messages himself stuck to it, non-matching slippers, and a pair of thick glasses with frames that have been composited of ha a dozen different old pairs all taped and welded together into a fantastic concoction. He is DOC HELLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Heller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't recognize  her) Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me... Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth! Little Elizabeth! Why  you're so... middle aged!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's right -- they squished  him... Heck of a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious throws a look at the Shoveler and Raja. This guy' out of it. They're wasting their time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc, these are my friends. We're  superheroes, and we need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I give to the United Way, and  I feel that sort of covers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, we need your weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) My weapons? You need my weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Doctor Heller leads them all briskly across his overgr yard toward... the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The military establishment has never  understood me. They won't return my  phone calls, much less field test  anything. But I knew that someday  I'd get my chance, and now... here  you are! (pulls open the barn  door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As our heroes step into Heller's laboratory/arsenal. A st of small aluminum cans lines one wall. There are weird lo sprayers, tubes, and strange homemade toy-like devices... but there isn't a firearm in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Doc... where's the machine guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bazookas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lasers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
